entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 with SAP Incentive Management for Real-time Incentive calculation
entry.content:
Integrating SAP Sales Cloud V2 with SAP SuccessFactors Incentive Management creates a powerful solution for real-time incentive calculation and sales performance optimization. Here's a breakdown of how this integration works and the benefits it offers:

Integration Overview

The mashup between SAP Sales Cloud V2 and SAP SuccessFactors Incentive Management enables sales teams to:

  • View real-time incentive data directly within the Sales Cloud interface.
  • Access a unified dashboard showing opportunities, leads, commissions, and payouts.
  • Receive instant updates as deals progress, with incentive data refreshed in real time.
  • Gain actionable insights into how performance affects earnings and what actions can maximize incentives.

Key Benefits

  1. Real-Time Insights & Motivation

    • Sales reps can see their commissions and performance metrics instantly.
    • Features like commission estimates, leaderboards, and performance dashboards help boost motivation.

  2. Streamlined Dispute Resolution

    • One-click traceability allows quick resolution of compensation inquiries.
    • Reduces administrative overhead and keeps reps focused on selling.

  3. Optimized Incentive Plans

    • Use AI-driven recommendations to refine compensation strategies.
    • Identify opportunities for bonuses or accelerators to maximize ROI.

  4. Flexible Plan Design

    • Easily model and test complex incentive plans using drag-and-drop tools.
    • Roll out new promotions without heavy IT involvement

Implementation Highlights

  • Once integrated, users can navigate to Sales History ‚Üí Opportunities in SAP Sales Cloud V2.
  • A new dashboard section appears showing incentives and payments.
  • The mashup is enabled via standard configuration steps provided by SAP.

Integration Flow Description

  1. SAP Sales Cloud V2

    • Opportunity is created and assigned to a Opportunity Owner (Sales Employee).
    • Opportunity data includes total revenue,opporuntiy date, product, and stage.

  2. Employee Sync

    • The Employee in Sales Cloud is synced with SuccessFactors via master data integration.
    • Employee is linked to a Position in Incentive Manager.

  3. SuccessFactors Incentive Management

    • The Position is mapped to an Incentive Plan.
    • Incentive Plan defines rules, rule elements including quotas, accelerators, and payout logic.

  4. Real-Time Calculation

    • As the Opportunity progresses, incentive calculations are triggered.
    • Sales reps can view estimated commissions, performance dashboards, and leaderboards directly in Sales Cloud.

  5. Feedback Loop

    • Incentive results are sent back to Sales Cloud for visibility.
    • Managers can adjust plans or resolve disputes using traceable data.

entry.title: SAP Connect 2025: The Ultimate Business Transformation Experience
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

I'm thrilled to introduce you to something completely new in the SAP events landscape: SAP Connect 2025, our groundbreaking annual event for business leaders that highlights how businesses maximize their SAP investments and accelerate transformation.

You've invested significantly in SAP solutions across your organization. Your CHRO relies on SAP SuccessFactors for talent management, your CPO uses SAP Ariba to optimize procurement, your CMO leverages SAP Customer Experience solutions to drive engagement, your CFO depends on SAP S/4 Finance to keep the business running, and your COO manages supply chain demand with SAP Integrated Business Planning. But here's the challenge every C-suite leader faces‚Äîhow do you connect your organization‚Äôs disconnected landscape so you can move beyond implementation to true business transformation?

 

 

Beyond Software: Your Partner in Business Success

While SAP is fundamentally a software company, our mission extends far beyond delivering technology. We empower business leaders, whether you're a CHRO building world-class teams, a CPO driving procurement excellence, a CMO creating customer loyalty, a CFO optimizing financial performance, or a COO ensuring operational excellence, to achieve transformational business outcomes.

The reality is that technology alone cannot be the sole factor in innovation. It's the strategic implementation and utilization of that technology that is aligned with your specific business challenges and opportunities that creates measurable value. SAP Connect 2025 is designed around this fundamental truth:

Your business outcomes are our primary measure of achievement.

 

 

The Reality Check: Where Most Organizations Stand Today

The 2025 C-Suite survey by Thomson Reuters Institute identified the following as the key challenges that currently hinder the effectiveness of enabling functions within organizations:

  1. Ineffective data and information flows between different departments
  2. Time-consuming compliance and reporting tasks
  3. Staffing and resourcing challenges, and
  4. Poor data quality and structure.

 

Do any of them sound familiar? Regardless of your role and vertical, these challenges continue to be roadblocks to achieving short- and long-term success for today‚Äôs businesses.

 

 

What Makes SAP Connect Different: Connect Everything, Achieve Anything

If you‚Äôre a seasoned business leader with SAP events, you‚Äôll notice that it‚Äôs looking a little different this year. Unlike the previous years of offering separate events for each department, SAP Connect is now one unified event with five specialized experiences, each designed for a specific department. This clearly illustrates the connection between SAP Business Suite and how these solutions work together to drive enterprise-wide value.

  • Success Connect: Transform your workforce with the latest HR solutions | Register
  • Spend Connect: Optimize business and realize opportunities  | Register
  • Customer Experience Connect: Drive customer loyalty and build relationships  | Register
  • Finance Connect: Revolutionize financial operations to beat market volatility  | Register
  • Supply Chain Connect: Build resilient, intelligent supply chain networks | Register

Each Connect event delivers deep, dedicated content while maintaining a connection to the broader SAP Business Suite ecosystem. You'll walk away with concrete strategies tailored to your specific business challenges.

 

 

How does the SAP Business Technology Platform fit in SAP Connect?

It couldn‚Äôt be more fitting! Like this year‚Äôs theme of ‚ÄòConnect everything. Achieve anything‚Äô, SAP Integration Suite within SAP Business Technology Platform is the answer to cross-organization connectivity. Integrating your across SAP and third-party applications allows you to build, extend and automate with SAP BuildÔøºmore to bring value to the business. Also, with prebuilt integration packages and AI-assisted features, the ROI can be achieved more efficiently. And of course, we can't forget about AI! With SAP Joule tailored for your developers' needs, you can generate code, automate processes, design intuitive UIs, and build custom agents using AI. 

Take these verified SAP BTP use cases as an example:

 

  1. Create a custom mobile app for HR using SAP Build: 

    1. Business challenge: Complex processes and access to business applications for field-based and deskless employees. Error-prone processes with little visibility into data and insights
    2. Business values: Reduced implementation time with low-code development tools. Improved employee efficiency by streamlining and automating processes
    3. Customer example: CITIC Pacific Mining Management Pty Ltd. integrated SAP SuccessFactors applications, then used SAP Build to automate document digitization in a safe and compliant way via their mobile web app. This eliminated manual information collection, entry, and validation, keeping the data always up-to-date and compliant. This allowed CITIC to save up to $A300,000 annually on worker productivity.

  2. Expedite your financial close with intelligent automation:

    1. Business challenge: Reliance on error-prone e-mail and spreadsheet tasks for financial closing, paired with time-consuming repetitive tasks.
    2. Business values: Automated tasks with SAP-curated agents and document task completion that decreases errors and strengthens data validation and verification.
    3. Customer example: De Agostini Publishing achieved significant automation improvements in its vendor invoice processing. Over 91% of PO-referred invoices are now processed automatically, and approximately 500 hours are saved per month through its SAP-based solution. The company successfully processes 54,000 paper-based vendor invoices annually while achieving 90-95% text capture accuracy from PDF invoices.

If you're interested, check out the full list of our verified SAP BTP use cases here.

 

 

What's Coming Next in This Series

In the next blog posts, I‚Äôll explore the five Connect experiences and highlight some of the sessions while providing a strategic framework for maximizing your SAP Connect experience and translating insights into business value. But don‚Äôt let that stop you from registering and checking out the event agenda to see all the sessions offered at Connect here!

Here‚Äôs also a blog from my colleague @rnoia  on SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary.

Stay tuned for Part 2!

entry.title: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì Blog #2 in the Series
entry.content:
In my previous blog, I discussed how SAP HANA Cloud delivers critical business benefits to organizations that migrate their database to the cloud. Advanced features such as multi-model engines allow enterprises to increase productivity and reduce complexity. In a recent study,[1]  IDC calculated that large enterprises can realize an annual average value of US$13.7 million by using SAP HANA Cloud.

Understanding how the specific capabilities of the database benefit your organization is key to helping you justify a cloud modernization initiative. Let‚Äôs look at two more capabilities that can help you build your business case for SAP HANA Cloud: infrastructure independence and a next-generation application foundation.

Infrastructure independence

Your database requirements constantly evolve. To keep up with changing business conditions, customer requirements, and user demand, you need an infrastructure that matches your needs. A solution that offers vendor independence is key.

SAP HANA Cloud offers multi-cloud flexibility so you can run on your hyperscaler of choice. The cloud-native architecture runs on Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Alibaba Cloud, and soon, SAP data centers. You can choose a hyperscaler without fear of vendor lock-in.

 

Because it uses cloud-native technologies, the architecture offers consistent, high performance no matter which provider you choose. Automated failover and recovery features enhance resilience. Database administrators can provision new instances in just minutes. And elastic scaling capabilities respond to changing workload demands in real time.

SAP HANA Cloud also reduces the complexity of database operations. It simplifies integration across hybrid or multi-cloud environments and provides direct access to data in SAP applications. Because SAP HANA Cloud is a fully managed database-as-a-service (DBaaS) from SAP, your IT personnel are free to focus on value-added tasks. What‚Äôs more, SAP HANA Cloud covers your database, infrastructure, and management requirements, eliminating the need for a separate infrastructure contract with your hyperscaler.

The IDC study assessed the financial impact of infrastructure independence and the associated flexibility. After deploying SAP HANA Cloud, study participants reported a 33% efficiency boost for their infrastructure teams and said that database deployments were executed 38% faster. Considering the costs of IT staff management, unplanned downtime, and database infrastructure, IDC calculated a 35% lower annual total cost of ownership for SAP HANA Cloud over a three-year period.

According to one study participant with a large database environment,

‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud has enabled us to redirect IT staff to focus more on the production environment, new development, integration, and leveraging AI. Overall, this allows them to help drive revenue and increase productivity.‚Äù

Next-generation application foundation

To gain business value from modern, intelligent applications, you need a sophisticated database that can support multiple data types from various sources, process data in real time, and deliver insightful analytics.

SAP HANA Cloud is part of SAP Business Technology Platform, an open cloud platform with data management, analytics, AI, IoT, blockchain technologies and application development services. Together, SAP HANA Cloud and SAP BTP form a full-stack solution that includes powerful integration features and an intuitive interface, all under one commercial model.  In addition, SAP HANA Cloud is the trusted database that powers SAP‚Äôs mission-critical solutions, such as SAP Business Cloud, with multi-model engines and enterprise-grade performance and reliability.

SAP HANA Cloud also empowers developers to create intelligent applications using today‚Äôs most advanced technologies. With this database, teams can build applications that use generative AI, machine learning, and specialized engines to handle vectors, knowledge graphs, property graphs, and spatial processing. It also manages semi-structured JSON data with ACID compliance. The resulting applications are context-aware and offer secure connections to critical business data and curated data products from SAP.

This integrated approach allows applications to ingest and process data in multiple formats and from various sources, including SAP and third-party solutions. Users get live access to critical business information without data replication. Native connectivity to various data sources unifies disparate data streams, offering a single holistic view of your enterprise data. Applications can respond to events in real time, support automated processes, and enable ad-hoc decision-making using current and historical data.

 Having a next-generation application foundation adds IT, performance, and business enablement benefits, according to the IDC study. After adopting SAP HANA Cloud, participating organizations realized a 33% efficiency boost for their infrastructure teams. Query speed and response time increased by 31% and 29%, respectively. Enterprises processed 151% more data sources and 77% greater data volume (in terabytes) than in previous environments. Business operations improved, thanks to enhanced analytics that led to better business decisions, an accelerated application development process, and more agile deployment of database resources. Participants also realized end-user productivity gains of 18%, leading to annual gross revenue gains of nearly $40 million per organization.

A study participant who works in the healthcare industry summarized the value of SAP HANA Cloud.

‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud provides my organization the ability to apply parallel processes and maintain scalable databases,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAs a result, we have been able to build a lot of applications with machine learning and AI capabilities. With SAP HANA Cloud, it is easier to integrate these applications.‚Äù

Explore other SAP HANA Cloud features to build your business case

Read the next blog to learn how multi-dimensional elastic scalability and intelligent data tiering features in SAP HANA Cloud can help you build your business case while preparing for the future of modern, intelligent applications and processes.

 

Additional resources:

What‚Äôs the potential value of SAP HANA Cloud for your organization? Complete a short assessment. 

Learn more about SAP HANA Cloud.

Discover how moving to SAP HANA Cloud helps you create a foundation for modernization.

Explore this guide on building a compelling business case to move your database to the cloud.

 

[1]  ‚ÄúThe Business Value of SAP HANA Cloud,‚Äù IDC, sponsored by SAP, April 2025.

entry.content:
‚ú®ü™Ñ Revellio ü™Ñ‚ú®

                                                                                                      üåüüîÆüßô‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü™Ñ‚ú®üßù‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüåü

‚ú®üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Unlocking SAP IAS Attribute Magic: Default vs Enrich Secrets Revealed üé©

About Me

Hare Krishna üôè I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

üåüIntroduction

When integrating SAP SaaS products on BTP, managing user attributes becomes a big challenge. Every app expects something slightly different‚Äîfrom hardcoded values to custom claim names. Without IAS, you'd have to tame these discrepancies in every corporate IdP or app individually, which isn't sustainable.

üîëIAS centralizes this with:

  1. üü¶ Default Attributes

  2. üü© Enrich Assertion Attributes

  3. ‚öôÔ∏èIdentity Federation controls which method is applied

üìòConcepts: When Which Mechanism Applies

Default vs. Enrich Assertion Attributes

SAP IAS provides two methods to control how attributes are sent to applications:

1. üü¶ Default Attributes

  • Configured at the application level inside IAS.

  • Can be static (hardcoded), pulled from IAS user store, or derived.

  • ‚úÖUsed when Identity Federation is enabled.

2. üü© Enrich Assertion Attributes

  • Configured in the corporate IdP connection inside IAS.

  • Uses values from the upstream IdP, with transformation before sending to apps.

  • ‚úÖUsed when Identity Federation is disabled.
    (üìÑ Official Doc)

üîÑIdentity Federation in IAS

Identity Federation decides whether IAS acts as the authoritative IdP üÜî or a proxy üîÄ:

  • Federation Enabled

    • IAS processes üü¶ Default Attributes.

    • Useful even when using corporate IdP‚ÄîIAS can inject hardcoded values like Groups = sac.

  • Federation Disabled

    • IAS functions as a pass-through proxy.

    • Only üü© Enrich Assertion Attributes are active, customizing only based on the upstream IdP data.
      (üìÑ Reference)

üí°This flexibility ensures SAP SaaS tools always receive what they expect‚Äîwithout demanding changes in your corporate IdP or each app.

üåüHow IAS Helps Customers

Setting up SSO for SAP SaaS apps can be tricky‚Äîeach service has its own attribute requirements. Without IAS, you‚Äôd constantly tweak your corporate IdP or each app.

With Default and Enrich Assertion Attributes, IAS provides a centralized layer to standardize attributes once and reuse across apps.

üîëReal-World Scenarios(few examples)

SAP ServiceRequiredHow IAS helps
Datasphere / SAC üìäGroups = sacA retail company can inject this via Default Attribute to authorize analysts without changing Azure AD groups.
Signavio üüßsignavio_groupsA manufacturing firm maps workspace groups via Enrich Assertion when federation is off, or as Default Attribute when federation is on‚Äîno IdP restructuring needed.
Kyma Runtime üåÄGroups as groupsA tech startup transforms incoming Group claims from Okta to groups for app provisioning without any code changes.
SAP BTP Services üî∑firstname, lastname, emailA logistics company ensures consistent user attributes from IAS or upstream IdP for automated user provisioning.

üí°Customer Value

  • Less Customization: Corporate IdPs remain clean; no per-app hacks.

  • Faster Rollouts: Onboard new SAP tools quickly.

  • Compliance & Governance: Centralized attribute control improves auditability.

  • Flexibility: Hardcode, map, or enrich attributes depending on SaaS needs‚Äîwithout breaking federation.

Whether it‚Äôs Datasphere, Signavio, or Kyma, IAS ensures your SSO setup just works, letting IT teams focus on business instead of identity headaches.

‚öôÔ∏èConfiguring Attributes in IAS ‚Äî Step-by-Step

Here‚Äôs how to set up each mechanism using the IAS Admin Console üñ•Ô∏è:

1. üü¶ Configure Default Attributes (for Federation Enabled)

  • Navigate to IAS Admin Console ‚Üí Applications.

  • Select your application (e.g., üìä Datasphere).

  • Go to Trust ‚Üí Assertion Attributes / Default Attributes.

  • Add Default Attribute:

    • Example: Groups = sac (hardcoded value)

    • Or map values: ${user.firstName}, ${user.company}

  • üíæSave and exit.
    (üìÑ Doc)

2. üü© Configure Enrich Assertion Attributes (for Federation Disabled)

  • Go to IAS Admin Console ‚Üí Identity Providers ‚Üí Corporate Identity Providers.

  • Select your corporate IdP (e.g., Microsoft Entra ID logo üîµ).

  • Open the Assertion Enrichment tab.

  • Add mapping rules:

    • Example: ${user.email} ‚Üí emailAddress

    • Example: ${customAttribute1} ‚Üí employeeNumber

  • üíæSave the configuration.
    (üìÑ Doc)

3. üß™ Test and Validate

  • Use IAS‚Äôs Test tool üß∞ or a SAML tracer üîç.

  • Confirm:

    • üü¶ Default Attributes appear with Federation Enabled.

    • üü© Enrich mappings appear with Federation Disabled.

üì∏Real-Life Example (Screenshot Placeholder)

entry.title: Why People Come Before Process and Technology in the SAP BTP Journey
entry.content:
When people talk about SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) or any transformation project, the conversation often begins with technology‚Äîdata models, extensions, integrations, and AI. But in my experience, the real magic of BTP doesn‚Äôt just come from its capabilities; it comes from the people who gather around it.

A platform becomes powerful when it inspires collaboration. That‚Äôs where community building comes in. Whether you‚Äôre a developer, architect, or business user, being part of a thriving community accelerates learning, drives adoption, and sparks innovation in ways no single project team can achieve alone.

Who I Am

I‚Äôm SAP BTP DevOps & AI Manager at Bluestonex (member of the SAP AppHaus Network), a mentor guiding SAP Tech professionals at Modish Tech (my own digital brand), and a trustee for The Sanatan Parivar charity, aiming to bring communities together.

I‚Äôve been fortunate to see SAP BTP evolve from its very beginnings, and I‚Äôm thankful to the organisations I worked for‚Äîand continue to work with‚Äîfor allowing me to explore it right from when it was first introduced. 

My passion lies in bridging innovation with community impact‚Äîusing technology not just to solve business challenges, but also to empower people. Over the years, I‚Äôve seen how focusing on people first changes the trajectory of projects, communities, and careers.

If you‚Äôd like to continue the conversation or just say hello, you can find me on LinkedIn.

Now, back to the topic...

Technology Is Only Part of the Equation

SAP BTP offers incredible capabilities that reshape business operations. But these tools are only as effective as the people who imagine, build, and sustain them. Without shared understanding, collaboration, and knowledge transfer, even the most advanced solutions risk becoming underutilised‚Äîor worse, becoming that ‚Äúcool proof of concept‚Äù everyone forgets about six months later.

The People-First Advantage

So what does ‚Äúpeople first‚Äù look like in the SAP BTP journey?

  • Confidence Through Enablement ‚Äì These days, enablement is the key. With an ever-changing tech stack‚Äîand especially in the SAP ecosystem, where constant branding and rebranding often push older content into the bin‚Äînewcomers are left confused about where to start. Classic example is SAP Integration Suite in the community is known by different names, CPI, IS, CI... everyone has their own version. We still refer Work Zone as the launchpad.  These are just few examples, I hear a lot from my mentees. This is why consistent enablement matters. Without it, people struggle to build confidence; with it, they can navigate the shifts, embrace the new, and grow faster.
  • Knowledge Sharing ‚Äì Empowering teams through open discussions, blogs, and mentorship ensures that expertise doesn‚Äôt sit in silos. It's easy to explore technology and build a proof of concept individually. But if we multiply this, it's even more powerful. This means everyone in a team is doing it, think about the productivity and work delivered by  the team.
  • Collaboration Over Isolation ‚Äì The best BTP outcomes I‚Äôve seen came from cross-functional teams and communities working together, not from lone experts. Let's be real, you cannot do everything on your own. You need people with expertise in different areas. 
  • Innovation Through Conversation ‚Äì Some of the most creative BTP use cases I‚Äôve seen didn‚Äôt start with a specification sheet; they started with people brainstorming and challenging each other. An example of this is the SAP BTP Monitor, which the team at Bluestonex delivered when we had nothing where we can see the SAP BTP consumption. Now SAP have come up with this option in the cockpit. There are many gaps, and people at Bluestonex fill these gaps with apps, all that starts with a conversation!

Rethinking the Balance

Process and technology will always matter‚Äîbut they‚Äôre accelerators, not starting points. When you put people first, you create an environment where processes can adapt and technologies can scale. Skip the people, and you risk building solutions that look great on paper but struggle in practice.

Building a Community That Lasts

That‚Äôs why community matters so much in the SAP BTP journey. Communities create ecosystems where growth is mutual‚Äîwhere experts share not just what they know, but also lift others to succeed. By doing so, they multiply value far beyond what technology alone can deliver.

This is why I‚Äôve chosen to write here. My goal is to contribute to a community where knowledge flows openly and people feel empowered to innovate together. In future posts, I‚Äôll share practical ways to accelerate BTP learning and adoption, grounded in the belief that people must always come first.

Join the Conversation

SAP BTP will continue to evolve, but one principle remains constant: people drive progress.

So, I‚Äôll leave you with this question: In your SAP BTP journey, how have people made a difference?

Your story might be the one that inspires someone else to grow. And if nothing else, you‚Äôll save someone from endlessly googling ‚ÄúIs it still called SAP Cloud Platform or‚Ä¶?‚Äù üòâ

entry.title: Kickstart Your SAP BTP Journey
entry.content:
All you need to know and where to start

You may have come across articles, presentations, interviews or discussions about SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). You heard the term quite often, but you might still be asking:  

  • What exactly is SAP BTP?
  • Why is SAP BTP important?
  • And how do I begin exploring SAP BTP‚Äôs potential?
  • How does SAP BTP fit into the clean core strategy?

You‚Äôre now at the right place.

Whether you're a decision maker looking to drive IT strategy, an IT professional building solutions, a business user focused on innovation, or part of the academic community exploring cutting-edge technologies, this post is your launchpad into the world of SAP BTP.

Curious where you fit in? Keep reading to discover the tools, learning paths, and support SAP BTP offers for every IT role: from developers and architects to students, educators, and decision makers.

No matter your background or goals, there‚Äôs a starting point tailored just for you.

 

What We‚Äôll Cover Here

  1. What Is SAP BTP?
  2. Why SAP BTP Matters
  3. SAP BTP and clean core
  4. Try Before You Buy: Trials & Pricing Models
  5. Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?
  6. SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role
  7. Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates
  8. Start building today!

 

What is SAP BTP?

SAP BTP is an intuitive, modern development and innovation platform for both professional IT and business users. It is a unified platform that brings quickly together everything you need to build any idea or business vision to life, extending, and integrating existing business applications, whether they‚Äôre SAP or not.

With self-service data discovery, modeling, planning, and analytics for business users in a governed environment, it provides integration solutions to connect and streamline applications and processes across the entire enterprise, offering pre-built business content like built-in data products, integrations, workflows, app templates, and AI services.

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs in the toolbox:

  • App Development & Automation: Rapidly develop applications or automate processes using low-code/no-code tools or opt for professional-code development when advanced customization and control are required
  • Data & Analytics: Turn your data into decisions with built-in analytics and planning tools.
  • Integration: Connect SAP or non-SAP systems like a pro.
  • Artificial Intelligence: Infuse AI into your workflows, apps, and decisions.
  • Platform Foundation: Secure, scalable, and ready for hybrid cloud environments.

Simply put, SAP BTP enables you to innovate and stay relevant by building on established foundations.

 

Why SAP BTP Matters?

Because digital transformation is not just a trend, it‚Äôs essential for adaptability and resilience, a.k.a. survival.

With SAP BTP, you can:

  • Automate repetitive tasks and free up time for real work.
  • Connect all of your systems, so they integrate.
  • Build custom apps tailored to your business needs and vision.
  • Use AI to make smarter decisions, faster.
  • Connect and harmonize all your data, eliminating data silos
  • Get mission-critical insights from your data without a background in data science

And the best part? You don‚Äôt have to start from scratch.
SAP BTP offers thousands of pre-built content packages, from application or automation templates to integration flows to dashboards to AI services.

 

SAP BTP and clean core

Clean core is a set of guiding principles that support continuous business transformation by designing agile, innovative and efficient ERP systems. The principles focus on building resilient business processes and extensions supported by seamless integration, efficient operations, and data quality.

Central to the clean core strategy are Side-by-side extensions, powered by SAP BTP.

Side-by-side extensions allow organizations to enhance their SAP landscapes without directly modifying the core SAP S/4HANA system: instead of embedding custom code within the core, new functionalities, integrations, and custom applications are developed and deployed independently on SAP BTP.

This approach leverages SAP BTP's robust services, including various runtime environments (like Cloud Foundry, Kyma, and the ABAP Environment), development tools (like SAP Business Application Studio and CAP), and critical integration services (like SAP Integration Suite and SAP Event Mesh). Connectivity is securely handled by tools like the SAP Cloud Connector for on-premise systems and the Destination Service, ensuring seamless data exchange via standard APIs and business events from the core.

 

Try Before You Buy: Free Trials & Flexible Pricing Models
Not ready to commit? No problem

SAP BTP offers a 90-day free trial with access to 30+ services.

You can explore, experiment, and learn at your own pace how to build, deploy, and integrate with a full suite of platform services.

Start here your free trial of SAP Business Technology Platform.

When you're ready to scale, you‚Äôve got options:

  • Free Tier: Build small apps, pay only for what you use.
  • Pay-As-You-Go: Great for dynamic needs and innovation projects.
  • Enterprise Agreement: Predictable pricing for known use cases.

Explore all the possibilities SAP BTP unlocks. We‚Äôve outlined the opportunities below:

 

Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?

Thousands of organizations, from global enterprises to emerging startups, are already leveraging SAP BTP to transform their operations. Let their success inspire you.
They are using SAP BTP to:

  • Automate supply chains
  • Personalize customer experiences
  • Streamline HR processes
  • Build AI-powered finance tools ... and achieve much more.

With over 33,000 customers and 3,200 partners, you'll be in excellent company.

See how SAP BTP customers are achieving a measurable impact across industries and lines of business.

 

SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role

Here‚Äôs your go-to list of resources to get rolling, matched to your role:

Note: This table is a starting point. Resource-role mappings are suggestions. Feel free to explore beyond your role based on your needs and interests. Find below what each of the resources has to offer.

SAP Discovery Center - Learn about SAP BTP Services in detail:

  • Start your experience with Guided Missions to bring real life use-cases to life
  • Reference established architectures patterns to guide your design and implementation
  • Understand how SAP BTP‚Äôs AI capabilities are used to infuse AI features into SAP‚Äôs solution portfolio
  • Create an estimate of your services to get a first impression about the usage cost.

SAP BTP Learning - Free learning journeys tailored to your role and pace:

  • Familiarize yourself with the basic concepts of SAP BTP.
  • Get enabled.
  • Plan your implementation.
  • Prepare for your go-live.

SAP BTP Guidance Framework - Provides a central access point for architects, developers, and administrators to build and run enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP:

  • Decision Guides: Quickly identify the best technology options for your specific needs.
  • Reference Architectures: Explore solution templates to effectively design and build on BTP, understanding key concepts and capabilities.
  • Methodologies: Access guided approaches to boost your cloud technology maturity, spanning both technical and organizational aspects.
  • Technology Recommendations: Evaluate and choose the right implementation options across various technology domains.
  • DevOps Principles: Empower your development and operations teams to achieve greater efficiency.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub  - Kickstart your projects with ready-to-use Business Content available for SAP BTP:

  • Integration: Access over 4,000 pre-built objects, including integration flows, scripts, value mappings, and message mappings, to streamline your connections with SAP Integration Suite
  • Development & Automation: Accelerate your projects with approximately 650 pre-built workflows, automations, applications, templates, and actions ready for use with SAP Build
  • Analytics: Jump-start your data insights using pre-built dashboards, stories, and data models specifically designed for SAP BTP's analytics capabilities
  • Information: Explore a rich repository of resources, including APIs, events, CDS views, business objects, interfaces, adapters, process blueprints, and SAP-validated partner use cases.

SAP Community - Connect with fellow SAP BTP users, ask questions and share ideas, get help and help others.

 

Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates

SAP Release Navigator - Keep up with the latest innovations and updates across SAP BTP, track new features and plan your adoption.

Road Map Explorer - Discover SAP‚Äôs product strategies and planned innovations with this go-to interactive tool. It highlights key advancements and offers a robust planning horizon, helping you precisely detail your transformation journey.

Strategy White Paper for SAP BTP - When you are ready to get deeper, discover more with SAP‚Äôs strategy for SAP BTP.

 

Start Building today!

Start your journey today with the SAP BTP Trial or explore your first mission at the SAP Discovery Center.

Got further questions? Drop them below and let‚Äôs build something amazing, together.

entry.title: Success Connect: Your People Deserve More Than Just Software - They Deserve Success
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

From Chief Human Resources Officers to HRIS managers to frontline people leaders, HR professionals at every level are navigating an increasingly complex talent landscape. The pressure to create exceptional employee experiences while driving measurable business outcomes has never been greater. Your organization's success depends not just on having the right technology, but on strategically leveraging that technology to transform how you attract, develop, and retain talent. SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite work together to help you achieve exactly that.

For Part 2 of this blog series on SAP Connect 2025, I'm excited to spotlight Success Connect 2025. It will provide CHROs with the next steps to focus on strategic workforce transformation, while delivering deep technical content for HRIS managers and HR technology professionals who implement and optimize these solutions daily.

If this is the first time you're hearing about SAP Connect 2025, read this blog first.

 

 

HR Going Beyond Traditional Boundaries

Today's HR leaders face unprecedented challenges. Regardless of your industry or organization size, you're expected to be data scientists, morale builders, strategic business partners, and technology innovators‚Äîall while maintaining the employee experience that defines great HR. On top of that, HR leaders are also faced with major obstacles in preparing their workforce for AI. With all these rapid changes in technology, the workforce‚Äôs generational differences, and your organization‚Äôs moving goals, where do you go from here?

 

By integrating, extending, and automating your SAP SuccessFactors solutions and processes, SAP Business Technology Platform doesn't just support your organization‚Äîit evolves it into what it was meant to be. This enables your existing HR processes to transform into the proactive talent strategy that drives measurable business value. Check out  SAP.com/btp-for-HR page for more in-depth information on how SAP BTP helps deliver better and more efficient HCM processes.

Here are my five must-attend sessions at Success Connect that will expand how you think about HR technology possibilities:

 

 

Your must-attend sessions at Success Connect

 

Scenario 1: Integration

 

Your Challenge: HR processes span multiple systems‚Äî the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite and third-party applications ‚Äîcreating fragmentation that leads to inefficiencies, data errors, and poor employee experiences. Read about the related use case here. 

The Solution: Discover how SAP Integration Suite enables seamless connections between SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite and your entire HR ecosystem. Explore integration use cases for recruiting, onboarding, and data collection, plus strategies for connecting hybrid landscapes with legacy on-premises systems. See how SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh enables you to monitor your event-driven system and manage various aspects of your event-driven architecture. Learn to automate immediate responses for hiring, role changes, and other critical workforce events.

Business Impact: Interconnected HR processes eliminate manual data entry, reduce the time needed to onboard new employees by 50%, and create consistent employee experiences regardless of underlying system complexity. Event-driven integration ensures new employees have system access on day one, eliminates security risks from delayed termination processing, and creates seamless workforce transitions.

If this is you, these sessions should be on your agenda:

 

Maximizing HCM Process Efficiency with Integration Through SAP BTP | HCM1665

Tuesday Oct 7 | 11:15 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM PDT

How to Use Event-Driven Integration to Collaborate in Real Time | HCM1682

 Wednesday Oct 8 | 12:30 PM ‚Äì 12:50 PM PDT

 

 

Scenario 2: Automation

 

Your Challenge: Your employees and HR teams spend valuable time on repetitive tasks, such as managing employee data and records, handling routine processes and more, instead of focusing on strategic HR activities that drive employee engagement and retention. Read about the related use case here. 

The Solution: Explore automation capabilities that streamline recruiting, onboarding, document management, and HR workflows. Learn how SAP BTP helps reduce manual errors while freeing your team to focus on high-value activities that directly impact employee experience.

Business Impact: HR process automation typically reduces administrative overhead by 60% while improving accuracy and employee satisfaction with HR services.

If this is you, this session should be on your agenda:

entry.title: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì Blog #3 in the Series
entry.content:
Welcome back to my blog series on the value of migrating to SAP HANA Cloud. In the first two blogs, I discussed how features such as multi-model engines, infrastructure independence, and a next-generation application foundation all can help you build your business case for SAP HANA Cloud.

In fact, we‚Äôve already seen powerful confirmation of the value of this database. For example, global consulting services provider CONTAX Inc. migrated to SAP HANA Cloud to gain the elasticity and scalability it needed to handle huge demands on its database resources. This modernization helped CONTAX expand its database capacity while reducing its overall memory footprint and cost by 25%.

That‚Äôs impressive. So how can you best estimate the benefits of migrating to SAP HANA Cloud for your enterprise?

Many organizations want to migrate their database to the cloud because they want to build and deploy intelligent applications at scale. But that requires an advanced data landscape architecture‚Äîa database-as-a-service (DBaaS) for modernizing your applications. Let‚Äôs talk about two capabilities of SAP HANA Cloud that help you meet that need and deliver exceptional value: intelligent data tiering and multi-dimensional elastic scalability.

Intelligent data tiering

The exploding growth of business data is both a cost issue and a management challenge for your business. How can you store the data users need and make it easily accessible without busting the budget?

Traditional database technology requires that you choose between database performance and costs. Should you pay more to over-provision storage space so data can be easily persisted in case of growing demands? Or should you archive data to save money but make data harder to access?

With SAP HANA Cloud, you can strike the right balance for your business.

 Intelligent, multi-temperature data management features help you store data in tiers according to type, operational usefulness, access frequency, and scalability requirements. The database locates frequently accessed, business-critical ‚Äúhot‚Äù data in high-performance, in-memory storage, which facilitates real-time processing. ‚ÄúWarm‚Äù data requiring moderate access uses disk storage. Infrequently accessed ‚Äúcold‚Äù data can be stored in a lower-cost data lake optimized for long-term retention and compliance.

By combining tiered storage with advanced virtualization capabilities, SAP HANA Cloud reduces cost and complexity while enabling optimum overall performance. Applications and users can query data at any tier without needing to know where the data is stored. Automatic optimization based on data location and access patterns eliminates complex, costly ETL processes‚Äîwhile supporting both operational efficiency and analytical depth. Data tiering also simplifies application development by offering one interface to multiple data tiers. Developers can use that interface to query data for applications without needing to know where the data is stored.

A recent IDC study [1] assessed database performance impacts for organizations that deployed SAP HANA Cloud. Query speed and response time improved by 31% and 29%, respectively. Backups executed 27% faster. Both data load time and recovery time were 24% faster.

‚ÄúData is more accessible with SAP HANA Cloud,‚Äù said one study participant. ‚ÄúIt is also available in real time and loads far quicker than our previous environment. Our data performance has enhanced.‚Äù

Multi-dimensional elastic scalability

Another way SAP HANA Cloud helps you balance performance and cost is by enabling elastic scalability for data processing and storage across multiple dimensions. In today‚Äôs dynamic database environments, short-term processing peaks caused by issues such as period-end reporting surges, seasonal transactions, or heavy analytics workloads can create havoc.

Elastic scalability lets you adjust compute and storage resources based on workload demands, in real time. The database ramps up resources during periods of high demand and then reduces them during low-usage times to conserve costs. Flexible resources include:

  • Performance classes, with flexible CPUs and memory ratios
  • Elastic compute nodes, on-demand resources provisioned in minutes for data-intensive OLAP workloads
  • Dynamic scalability, with individual storage tiers that allow the database to grow or shrink as needed

SAP HANA Cloud also includes elasticity features such as class-based dynamic workload routing, which automatically sends queries to the most appropriate compute resources. An ECN advisor analyzes historical workload patterns and creates optimal provisioning schedules. To prevent scaling events from disrupting application performance, SAP HANA Cloud offers built-in monitoring and workload routing capabilities.

These elastic scalability features help you respond rapidly to changing business needs, enabling optimal performance without over provisioning resources. These features make data more accessible to users while reducing infrastructure complexity. Together, they can help you drive operational agility and cost-effective resource management.

With these benefits in mind, IDC evaluated the infrastructure costs of surveyed companies that deployed SAP HANA Cloud. Using its business value methodology, IDC concluded that the infrastructure costs of an SAP HANA Cloud environment were 20% less than a comparable database environment over a three-year period.

According to one study participant operating in the retail industry, ‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud has given my organization the ability to scale and reduce redundancy, which are significant benefits.‚Äù

Explore other SAP HANA Cloud features to build your business case

Read the next blog to learn how native AI capabilities, built-in data integration, and automation that streamlines database administrator duties can help you build your business case for SAP HANA Cloud while preparing for the future of modern, intelligent applications and processes.

Additional resources:

What‚Äôs the potential value of SAP HANA Cloud for your organization? Complete a short assessment. 

Learn more about SAP HANA Cloud.

Discover how moving to SAP HANA Cloud helps you create a foundation for modernization.

Explore this guide on building a compelling business case to move your database to the cloud.

 

 [1] ‚ÄúThe Business Value of SAP HANA Cloud,‚Äù IDC, sponsored by SAP, April 2025.

entry.title: SAP OData to MCP Server running on BTP
entry.content:
Transform your SAP S/4HANA or ECC system into a conversational AI interface by exposing all OData services as dynamic MCP tools. This enables natural language interactions with your ERP data:

  • "Show me 10 banks" ‚Üí Automatically queries the Bank entity with $top=10
  • "Update bank with ID 1 to have street number 5" ‚Üí Executes PATCH operation on Bank entity
  • "Create a new customer with name John Doe" ‚Üí Performs POST to Customer entity
  • "List all purchase orders from this week" ‚Üí Applies $filter for date range on PurchaseOrder entity

Prerequisite

CloudFoundry CLI installed: https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/cf-cli/install-go-cli.html 

BTP Account with CloudFoundry active and a space:

Cloud Connector with principal propagation

Install

Go to the GitHub repository: https://github.com/lemaiwo/btp-sap-odata-to-mcp-server

Click on the green button ‚ÄúCode‚Äù and copy the url:

git clone https://github.com/lemaiwo/btp-sap-odata-to-mcp-server.git
cd btp-sap-odata-to-mcp-server

Copy the example.env file into a .env file and configure it to your needs, find more information in the Configure and Options section

npm run build:btp
cf login -a <cf api endpoint of BTP>
npm run deploy:btp

Once deployed, you'll find it in the list of applications in BTP CloudFoundry:

 

Configure

Create two destinations:

  • one with principal propagation to have SSO which will be used to executed OData queries with the user JWT 
  • one with a technical user that is used while starting the server to scan the OData services of the system and already preload the metadata

Technical destination:

Destination with principal propagation:

 

Copy the .env.example file to .env and configure it as follows to have the recommended settings but replace the ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS with your preferred selection:

SAP_DISCOVERY_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_SYSTEM_TECH
SAP_EXECUTION_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_SYSTEM_SSO
# SAP_DESTINATION_NAME=your-own-destination

LOG_LEVEL=debug

# OData Service Discovery Configuration Examples
# Method 1: Allow all services (use * or 'true')
ODATA_ALLOW_ALL=false

# Method 2: Specify service patterns (supports glob patterns)
# Comma-separated list of patterns
ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS=*TASKPROCESSING*,*BOOK*,*FLIGHT*,*TRAVEL*,*TRVEXP*,*TRAVELAGENCY*,*TRAVELAGENCYSRV*,*TRAVELAPPROVALS*,*TRAVELAPPROVALS_SRV*,*ZBP*,*ZTRANSPORT*,*ZBC_UI_PARAM_E_CDS*

# Method 3: Use JSON array for more complex patterns
# ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS=["ZBP*", "ZTRANSPORT*", "/^Z.*_CDS$/"]

# Method 4: Use regex patterns (enclose in forward slashes)
# ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS=/^Z(BP|TRANSPORT).*/

# Exclusion patterns (services to exclude even if they match inclusion patterns)
ODATA_EXCLUSION_PATTERNS=*_TEST*,*_TEMP*

# Maximum number of services to discover (prevents system overload)
ODATA_MAX_SERVICES=50

# Discovery mode: 'all', 'whitelist', 'regex'
ODATA_DISCOVERY_MODE=whitelist

Use

Copy the url of the application

Go to your AI Agent/LLM, eg.: Claude AI desktop, open tools and click on Manage connectors:

Click on "Add custom connector" :

Give the MCP server a name and paste the url of the application in BTP with ‚Äú/mcp‚Äù added to it:

It might take some time before it is shown. For some reason, Claude Dekstop first try‚Äôs to connect without authentication and then takes some time before showing the system:

After some time it should become visible:

Once the system is visible, you can click on the connect button. This will redirect you to BTP to login. First time it might ask you to login to claude, after that it should give you the sap login or your corporate idp, if not, try clicking a second time on connect:

Once authenticated, you‚Äôll find your SAP system in the set of tools:

Start asking questions:

Options

A key capability is deploying the MCP Server to different spaces within the same subaccount. This lets you set up multiple MCP servers with different configurations. For example, you can configure an MCP server for each SAP system in your landscape, or set up one for each domain ‚Äî such as one MCP server for all HR OData services, another for all Materials Management (MM) OData services, and so on.

Core Configuration

Configuration Option

Description

Example Values

Notes

SAP_DISCOVERY_DESTINATION_NAME

SAP destination for service discovery (uses technical user)

SAP_SYSTEM_TECH

Used for metadata operations

SAP_EXECUTION_DESTINATION_NAME

SAP destination for data operations (uses JWT forwarding for SSO)

SAP_SYSTEM_SSO

Used for actual data access with user context

SAP_DESTINATION_NAME

Single destination for both discovery and execution

SAP_SYSTEM

Legacy option for backward compatibility

MCP_TOOL_REGISTRY_TYPE

Defines how tools are organized in the registry

hierarchical (default)
flat

IMPORTANT: hierarchical exposes all OData services as just 4 tools. flat exposes EVERY CRUD operation for EACH entity as separate tools. While this can exceed limits with many services, flat mode can be beneficial for small, focused deployments

LOG_LEVEL

Controls the verbosity of application logging

error, warn, info, debug

Default is info

DISABLE_READ_ENTITY_TOOL

Disables ReadEntity tool registration

true, false (default)

Useful for performance with large datasets

 

‚ö†Ô∏èCRITICAL CONFIGURATION NOTE: The MCP_TOOL_REGISTRY_TYPE setting has a major impact on tool exposure:

  • hierarchical mode (recommended for most cases):
      - Exposes all OData services through just 4 unified tools
      - Keeps the tool count manageable regardless of service count
      - Requires agents to first discover services, then entities

  • flat mode:
      - Creates individual tools for EVERY CRUD operation for EACH entity
      - Can quickly exceed system limits with many services (hundreds/thousands of tools)
      - Significantly increases token consumption
      - HOWEVER: Can be advantageous for small, focused deployments (1-2 services)
        where direct tool names like "Create_BusinessPartner" or "Update_SalesOrder"
        make it easier for agents to find and use the right tool without discovery steps

 

OData Service Discovery Configuration

Configuration Option

Description

Example Values

Notes

ODATA_ALLOW_ALL

Allow discovery of all available services

true, false (default)

Use * or true to enable

ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS

Specify which services to include using patterns

See examples section

Supports multiple pattern formats

ODATA_EXCLUSION_PATTERNS

Services to exclude even if they match inclusion patterns

*_TEST*,*_TEMP*

Comma-separated list

ODATA_MAX_SERVICES

Maximum number of services to discover

50 (example)

Prevents system overload

ODATA_DISCOVERY_MODE

Controls how service discovery works

all, whitelist, regex

Determines pattern matching behavior

 

Service Pattern Examples

Pattern Type

Example

Description

Glob Patterns

*TASKPROCESSING*,*BOOK*

Use wildcards (*) to match multiple services

Specific Services

*TRAVEL*,*TRAVELAGENCY*

Target specific service names

Prefix Matching

ZBP*,ZTRANSPORT*

Match services starting with specific prefixes

JSON Array

["ZBP*", "ZTRANSPORT*"]

Complex patterns in JSON format

Regex Patterns

/^Z(BP|TRANSPORT).*/

Regular expressions in forward slashes

 

Configuration Examples

Example 1: Enterprise Setup with Separate Authentication

Use Case: Large enterprise SAP landscape with strict security requirements

# Separate destinations for security
SAP_DISCOVERY_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_ECC_TECH_USER
SAP_EXECUTION_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_ECC_SSO

# Use hierarchical mode for many services
MCP_TOOL_REGISTRY_TYPE=hierarchical

# Whitelist specific business services
ODATA_DISCOVERY_MODE=whitelist
ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS=*SALESORDER*,*PURCHASEORDER*,*BUSINESSPARTNER*,*MATERIAL*
ODATA_EXCLUSION_PATTERNS=*_TEST*,*_TEMP*,*_DEV*
ODATA_MAX_SERVICES=100

# Production logging
LOG_LEVEL=info

Example 2: Development Environment - All Services

Use Case: Development/sandbox environment where developers need access to all services

# Single destination for simplicity
SAP_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_DEV_SYSTEM

# Hierarchical for many services
MCP_TOOL_REGISTRY_TYPE=hierarchical

# Allow all services in dev
ODATA_ALLOW_ALL=true
ODATA_EXCLUSION_PATTERNS=*_ARCHIVE*
ODATA_MAX_SERVICES=200

# Debug logging for development
LOG_LEVEL=debug

Example 3: Focused HR Service - Flat Mode

Use Case: Small MCP server dedicated to HR operations with direct tool access

# HR-specific destination
SAP_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_HR_SYSTEM

# Flat mode for direct tool access
MCP_TOOL_REGISTRY_TYPE=flat

# Only HR-related services
ODATA_DISCOVERY_MODE=whitelist
ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS=*EMPLOYEE*,*ORGUNIT*,*TIMESHEET*
ODATA_MAX_SERVICES=5

# Standard logging
LOG_LEVEL=info

# Note: This creates tools like:

# - Create_Employee

# - Update_TimeSheet

# - Delete_OrgUnit

# Making it easy for agents to directly use HR operations

 

Example 4: Custom Services with Regex Patterns

Use Case: Organization with custom-developed Z* and Y* services

# Technical user for custom services
SAP_DISCOVERY_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_CUSTOM_TECH
SAP_EXECUTION_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_CUSTOM_SSO

# Hierarchical for scalability
MCP_TOOL_REGISTRY_TYPE=hierarchical

# Regex pattern for custom services
ODATA_DISCOVERY_MODE=regex
ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS=/^[ZY].*_SRV$/
ODATA_EXCLUSION_PATTERNS=*_OLD*,*_BACKUP*
ODATA_MAX_SERVICES=75

# Info level for production
LOG_LEVEL=info
DISABLE_READ_ENTITY_TOOL=false

Example 5: Multi-Domain Setup with Complex Patterns

Use Case: Multiple business domains with specific service requirements

# Separate auth for compliance
SAP_DISCOVERY_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_PROD_METADATA
SAP_EXECUTION_DESTINATION_NAME=SAP_PROD_USER_AUTH

# Hierarchical for large service count
MCP_TOOL_REGISTRY_TYPE=hierarchical

# Complex pattern matching using JSON array
ODATA_SERVICE_PATTERNS=["*FI_*", "*CO_*", "*MM_*", "*SD_*", "/^Z(FI|CO|MM|SD).*/"]
ODATA_EXCLUSION_PATTERNS=*_TEST*,*_TMP*,*_BCK*,*_DECOMMISSIONED*
ODATA_MAX_SERVICES=150

# Standard production settings
LOG_LEVEL=info
DISABLE_READ_ENTITY_TOOL=false

# This configuration covers:

# - Finance (FI) services

# - Controlling (CO) services 

# - Materials Management (MM) services

# - Sales & Distribution (SD) services

# - Custom services for these modules

 

Tool Registry Mode Comparison

Scenario 1: Large SAP Deployment
10 OData services, each with 5 entities:

hierarchical mode: 4 tools total (search, discover, schema, execute)

flat mode: 10 services √ó 5 entities √ó 4 CRUD = 200 individual tools ‚ùå Not recommended

 

Scenario 2: Focused Deployment
1 Business Partner service with 3 entities (Partner, Address, Contact):

hierarchical mode: 4 generic tools (requires discovery steps)

flat mode: 12 specific tools like "Create_BusinessPartner", "Update_Address" ‚úÖ Could be optimal

 

üí°RECOMMENDATION:
‚Ä¢ Use hierarchical for standard deployments and when exposing multiple services
‚Ä¢ Consider flat only for small, focused MCP servers (1-2 services) where you want to keep the MCP server small and optimize for direct tool discovery by agents
‚Ä¢ Always exclude test/temporary services in production environments
‚Ä¢ Set appropriate ODATA_MAX_SERVICES limits to prevent performance issues

entry.title: SAP BTP AI Best Practices: A Deep Dive into Key Technical Foundations
entry.content:
In our first post of this campaign - SAP BTP AI Best Practices: Your Ultimate Guide for Building AI Solutions - we introduced the initiative that brings together technical recommendations, architectural patterns, and practical insights to help customers and partners successfully design, build, and operate AI solutions on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP).

These BTP AI Best Practices are accessible from the Discovery Center. To get more details, you can check SAP BTP Guidance Framework and the SAP BTP Guidance Framework - Introduction Post.

In this post, we‚Äôre going to focus on six best practices that are fundamental for building reliable, secure, and scalable Generative AI scenarios on SAP BTP.

  • Access to Generative AI Models

Access management is one of the first challenges when working with Generative AI. SAP BTP provides secure connectivity to a wide range of AI models, ensuring compliance with enterprise standards while enabling flexibility for innovation. Following this best practice guarantees:

  • Controlled usage of models in productive environments
  • Alignment with governance and audit requirements
  • Seamless integration of AI capabilities into SAP applications and custom extensions
  • Prompt Templating

Well-structured prompts are critical to consistent AI outcomes. Prompt templating best practices allows developers and business users to:

  • Reuse standardized prompt structures across multiple scenarios
  • Improve reproducibility of AI responses
  • Facilitate collaboration by separating prompt logic from business logic

By adopting prompt templating, organizations reduce variability and ensure higher quality outputs when leveraging Generative AI.

  • Data Masking

Data privacy remains a cornerstone of AI adoption. Data masking is key to protecting sensitive information before it is processed by AI services. This best practice addresses:

  • Anonymization of personal and business-critical data
  • Compliance with GDPR and other data protection regulations
  • Enabling safe experimentation without risking data leaks

Applying data masking ensures that AI innovations can move forward responsibly and securely.

  • Content Filtering

AI systems need guardrails to prevent misuse or harmful outputs. Content filtering best practices help organizations:

  • Detect and block inappropriate or non-compliant AI-generated content
  • Maintain trust in AI-driven user experiences
  • Align with corporate and ethical AI principles

This step is crucial for making AI solutions both safe and enterprise-ready.

  • Vector RAG ‚Äì Embedding

A solid embedding strategy is the foundation of effective Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). This best practice covers how to:

  • Represent domain-specific knowledge in a vectorized form
  • Optimize embeddings for retrieval efficiency and relevance
  • Enable your AI models to ground responses in enterprise data
  • Vector RAG ‚Äì Query Pipeline

The query pipeline orchestrates how user queries interact with the vector store. Following this best practice helps you:

  • Ensure accurate and contextually relevant retrieval
  • Implement scalable and efficient query flows
  • Reduce hallucinations by grounding AI outputs in trusted enterprise data

Meet the experts who shaped this initiative

The SAP BTP AI Best Practices initiative is led by Markus Albrecht, SVP & GM, ASC BTP Solution Area, and developed in collaboration with a core team of experts committed to helping developers succeed with AI on SAP BTP.

By combining diverse expertise, hands-on experience, and deep technical knowledge, this team has ensured that the best practices are not only practical and enterprise-ready, but also closely aligned with real-world customer needs.

You Might Also be Interested In

These six best practices are just a selection from the broader collection available. Together, they form the technical backbone of secure and scalable AI adoption on SAP BTP. Visit all BTP AI Best Practices .

In the upcoming posts, we will continue exploring additional best practices in depth. In the meantime, you can dive even deeper through dedicated videos available on the official SAP YouTube channel, where our experts walk you through the concepts, use cases, and demos behind these best practices.

Feedback on SAP BTP AI Best Practices can be provided here.

Stay Tuned

This blog post is part of our ongoing series, Exploring the SAP BTP Guidance Framework, where we spotlight key resources that help you build smarter, faster, and with more confidence on SAP BTP. In the next post, we‚Äôll continue diving into different areas of the framework‚Äîso stay tuned and follow along as we explore more ways to turn ideas into enterprise-grade solutions.

entry.title: Build a Data-Driven Enterprise with SAP‚Äôs Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology
entry.content:
What is SAP BTP Guidance Framework: The Guidance Framework provides clear direction and a structured approach to adopting SAP technologies. With this guidance, you can develop intelligent applications using advanced analytics, equipping your organization with a robust foundation to support agile innovation. For more details read this blog. 

In this blog post, we will look into how to build a Data-Driven Enterprise with SAP‚Äôs Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology under SAP BTP Guidance Framework. You can find this Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology pillar under SAP BTP Guidance Framework. 

It‚Äôs imperative that in today‚Äôs economy, data is more than just numbers‚Äîit‚Äôs the foundation of innovation, strategy, and growth backed by AI. Yet many organizations still struggle to unlock the full potential of their data and give it purpose. SAP‚Äôs Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology under SAP BTP Guidance Framework offers a structured, four-phase approach that helps enterprises transform raw data into actionable insights while building a strong data-driven culture. 

The Four Phases of SAP‚Äôs Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology 

1. Scoping & Baseline Analysis: In this phase you can set the foundation by: 

  • Defining the scope of investigation across business processes, organizational units, and data domains. 
  • Assessing current data architecture and capabilities. 
  • Identifying gaps, pain points, and opportunities for improvement. 

Benefit of this phase is that your business will have a clear baseline architecture, capability assessment, and prioritized opportunities. 

2. Business Outcomes & Solution Requirements: the focus in this phase shifts to aligning data with measurable business goals such as:  

  • Define specific, data-driven business outcomes. 
  • Analyze use cases that trace how raw data transforms into business value. 
  • Identify required data products and map end-to-end integration flows. 

This phase allows to clearly define business outcome definitions and solution context diagrams. 

 3. Capability Map & Solution Architecture: this phase transforms requirements into a target architecture by: 

  • Developing a capability map using SAP BTP Maturity Assessment 
  • Explore architecture options through traditional capability mapping or solution diagrams from the SAP Discovery Center. 
  • Validate the preferred architecture with proof-of-concepts. 

With this phase the target solution architecture is validated through capability mapping and pilots. 

 4. Data Governance & Roadmaps: this final phase ensures long-term sustainability: 

  • Conduct a maturity assessment for data governance and organizational roles. 
  • Define roles such as Chief Data Officer, Data Steward, and Governance Manager. 
  • Build a roadmap with clear clusters (e.g., implementation, operations, security). 

The key benefit of this phase is to define Data governance framework, organizational structure, and a roadmap for execution. 

What makes SAP‚Äôs Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology stand out is that it‚Äôs not just about technology‚Äîit‚Äôs about data, people and processes. By integrating governance, roles, and organizational change management, it ensures that data initiatives aren‚Äôt just implemented but also adopted across the enterprise. For organizations aiming to thrive in a data-driven economy, SAP‚Äôs Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology provides more than a roadmap‚Äîit delivers a proven framework for turning data into business value and give it purpose. By combining architecture best practices with governance and cultural adoption, it helps enterprises evolve from simply managing data to truly innovating with it. 

To read more about SAP‚Äôs Data & Analytics Advisory Methodology check out SAP Discovery Center.

entry.title: SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Center of Expertise (CoE), Administration and DevOps
entry.content:
As outlined in the blog post SAP BTP Guidance Framework: A Compass for Architects, Developers, and Administrators from Cecily Sorenson (@cecilysorenson), the SAP BTP Guidance Framework offers a practical framework for anyone using SAP BTP. In this blog post, let's focus especially on the organizational setup and the role and tasks of an administrator. 

Overview of SAP BTP Guidance Framework - and focus of this blog post

Here, the SAP BTP Guidance Framework brings a lot to get you started! 

 

Organizational Setup 

One main question faced in almost every SAP BTP project is on the best organizational setup to ease a smooth onboarding, reduce time to value and to operate the platform effectively. One key aspect can be the founding of a central platform engineering team or a Center of Expertise (CoE) that is responsible for such topics as account operations, infrastructure, central governance and compliance - and for driving the overall cloud adoption across the organization. 

A CoE can make the difference and help your cloud development teams to transition towards a cloud-centric mindset and processes, as the provided guidance allows them to focus more on providing business value without having to bother about finding, implementing and running the right infrastructure and processes. 

Therefore, it should be no surprise that the SAP BTP Guidance Framework offers guidance here as well, in the form of the SAP BTP Center of Expertise (CoE) Guide. 

The guide provides a comprehensive framework for establishing and scaling an SAP BTP CoE. For example, it gives a definition of a CoE, outlines a corresponding maturity model, explains roles and responsibilities, and gives practical guidance on how to implement it along the lifecycle. 

Overview of maturity model explained in the SAP BTP CoE Guide

 

Administrating the Platform and the Lifecycle 

To learn more about actual tasks and responsibilities for administrating the platform itself and for handling the lifecycle of your applications and use cases running on it, the SAP BTP Guidance Framework offers the SAP BTP Administrator's Guide. 

Understand basic concepts and tasks, before benefitting from guidance and best practices along topics such as: 

  • Your account model 
  • Delivering your applications and changes towards your runtime with the right mix of agility and control 
  • Operating your applications on SAP BTP, with a combination of central observability (to get aware of how your business scenarios are behaving) and local observability tools for root cause analysis in case of issues or performance degradations 

This also comprises check lists, examples and guidance. For example, here‚Äôs an example for an individual account model: 

Picture of an exemplary account model for SAP BTP

 

DevOps with SAP BTP 

When transitioning to the cloud, you want to benefit from modern development principles in the spirit of DevOps. But how does this fit to stricter boundary conditions faced in an enterprise environment? 

Here, the SAP BTP Guidance Framework also has you covered - by offering a description how to enable your development teams to benefit from tight feedback loops offered by automated build and test pipelines ("Continuous Integration") in combination with the right level of control for the delivery towards production. 

Overview of DevOps approach with SAP BTP

For this, your development teams can use pipeline templates to set up a running build and test pipeline for typical SAP BTP development use cases - thanks to our opinionated "Pipeline-as-a-Service" approach, they can set them up in minutes and run them with crucially reduced cognitive load. These pipelines then can qualify the development changes in terms of provided functionality, usage of outdated libraries, code issues, and other compliance-relevant aspects, as needed by your business. 

As soon as your development teams come up with correspondingly qualified release candidates, they can easily switch on in the pipeline the automated handover of the changes into a central, reliable transport and change management approach. Here, your administration team can centrally define delivery landscapes, including permissions on who is allowed to come up and handle changes where and a central log file for auditing reasons. This can be decoupled from the development teams who only need to know the entry node to the delivery, using a clearly defined hand-over process from qualified agile development into controlled delivery towards production.  

With a simple integration of transport management into SAP's central operation platforms, this can even be extended to central change management processes, to handle interdependencies of changes from different environments by centrally orchestrating their propagation across SAP BTP, SAP S/4HANA, or SAP cloud solutions. All this can be enriched with additional release planning and management capabilities. 

 

Summary 

The SAP BTP Guidance Framework has a lot to offer also for administrators ‚Äì from a framework to forge your organizational setup to guidance on how to handle the lifecycle of your applications and use cases on SAP BTP and on how to combine agile development with the right level of control over changes in your runtime environment. 

If you should have feedback on the documents and offerings mentioned above, please let us know ‚Äì ideally by providing feedback in SAP Help Portal, as described for example here: SAP BTP Documentation Goes GitHub - New Collaborat... - SAP Community

entry.title: SAPinsider EMEA 2025 in Three Easy Steps
entry.content:
Returning for a third year in succession, SAPinsider EMEA 2025 will open it‚Äôs doors at the Tivoli Hotel in Copenhagen next week on 1st October. And I know that the SAP team is all set and ready to go, having spent the past few months working on content and exhibition planning for this annual conference.

And with the inside scoop on our session plan this year, I also know that we have a lot to talk about and share with the many SAP customers and business partners who are planning to attend this year. So l for one am looking forward to our third outing here, in the charming city of Copenhagen.

So, in what has now become an annual event in itself, I am writing this blog to give you a sneak peek of SAP‚Äôs conference plans, and how to make the most of the event in three easy steps. And yes, of course, this will include details of my personal top picks for must-see SAP sessions!  

Step 1: Plan Ahead

As a conference attendee you‚Äôll be invited to download the latest SAPinsider event app before you travel to Copenhagen, so my advice is do install this before you go and then spend some time whilst travelling selecting sessions and adding them to your personal agenda. Don‚Äôt leave this until you get there ‚Äì you'll find yourself busy with sessions and conversations, and very little time for planning. So pre-planning is always best, and then you‚Äôll arrive with a purpose, and ready to make the most of the educational and networking opportunities available.

To give you a head-start, here are some ideas for sessions to see, and my personal top picks:

  1. The keynotes ‚Äì yes, both of them! In the day 1 keynote, SAP‚Äôs Jorrit de Groot will share insights on how customers are partnering with SAP to leverage SAP Business Suite to overcome key business challenges. On day 2 the keynote will focus on NOVO Nordisk‚Äôs experience of their own transition to SAP S/4HANA. With lots of practical advice offered in both keynote sessions, I‚Äôm sure these will be of great interest to anyone considering or already involved in their own business transformation project.
  2. Conference sessions. There‚Äôs a lot to choose from, however here are five sessions from the SAP team to add to your agenda:
    1. Transforming Finance with AI: What's Here, What's Next, and How to Prepare
    2. AI Won't Take Your Job‚ÄîBut Someone Using It Might
    3. Unlocking Growth and Agility with SAP's Two-Tier Cloud ERP Model
    4. SAP Business Data Cloud: Product Overview, Updates, and Roadmap
    5. SAP Integration Suite: Product Strategy, Innovations, and Roadmap
  3. Hands-on-Labs. Get up close and personal with SAP solutions, in these three sessions:
    1. Extend SAP S/4HANA (Cloud ERP) with SAP Build While Keeping the Core Clean
    2. Modernize Enterprise Integrations Across Hybrid Landscapes with SAP Integration Suite
    3. The SAP Security Game

And of course there are many other sessions, including customer case stories, listed on the event agenda too.

Step 2: Network with peers and industry experts

Another ‚Äúnot to be missed‚Äù opportunity at SAPinsider is the chance to network with industry peers, SAP business partners and the SAP team. This event never fails to deliver as an excellent networking opportunity, and I for one will be taking my time to make the most of it.

In terms of networking, I along with several colleagues will be helping to support the SAP exhibit booth at the event this year, so why not come along to say hello and have a chat at our new-look exhibit booth? We're really looking forward to having some great conversations with event attendees this year, so please don‚Äôt be shy, join us at the SAP booth and ask any questions you might have‚Ä¶and in addition you can also voice your opinion too, as we‚Äôre once again offering you the chance to tell us what you think about SAP solutions, as we‚Äôre partnering again with Trust Radius, who will be taking product reviews at the SAP booth too.

Step 3: Make the most of your free time‚Ä¶but continue those conversations!

Conference days are busy, and if you make the most of them you‚Äôll find yourself in need of some rest and relaxation‚Ä¶but not too much of course, you‚Äôre still there to work after all! So if you're thinking of using the free time you have to take in the sights, sounds and tastes of Copenhagen, then why not consider planning for some out of conference meetings with colleagues, peers, partners and the SAP team when they‚Äôre ‚Äúoff the clock‚Äù, and continue your networking conversations over evening dinner, or whilst taking that stroll by the Nyhavn Canal.

See you there!

For those of you travelling to Copenhagen, I do hope that you find SAPinsider EMEA 2025 to be a truly rewarding experience. Remember to take time to create an agenda in the event app, and of course if you visit the show floor then look me up at the SAP exhibit booth.

Safe travels and see you in Copenhagen!

Chris Grundy

Product Marketing, SAP BTP
